intro: Elisanthe, commonly known as the "false flax," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Onagraceae. It consists of several species, many of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Elisanthe plants typically have slender, branching stems and small, often blue or purple flowers. They are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including meadows and roadsides. The genus is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers and capsule fruits.
